item.description:
This 9th annual event will take place at Veterans Park, site "B", next to the pool in Middletown from 1 - 5 p.m. It located Â½ miles from the Mansfield Freeman Center for East Asian Studies.

There is electricity, restrooms, grill and pavilion. It is a potluck picnic. So we need vegetarian and well as non-vegetarian food. We also need non-alcoholic refreshments. Please bring an item or two, and of course a few friends. We will try to have some Buddhist flags up to help you to recognize us more easily.



E-mail Matt for Potluck




Please contact our coordinator Matt who will harmonize your potluck offerings. Tell him what dish you are going to bring so he can be sure we do not get 5 potato salads, 10 cakes, etc. Please e-mail Matt at foleyart@comcast.net

What do we celebrate?



In this picnic, we honor those Americans who sacrificed so much to keep our nation and others free. In addition, Wisteria Festival celebrates the birth of Shinran Shonin, the founder and foremost teacher who was born almost 750 years ago.


Directions



Visit Google Map for directions

http://maps.google.co...


IMPORTANT: There will be no Wesleyan Gathering that Sunday


See our main WEB SITE BELOW.

See our CALENDAR @

www.bffct.net
item.how_to_find_us: We will be on site "B" we may have Buddhist flags on display -- it is near the pool

group.name: Buddhist Faith Fellowship in Middletown, Ct

item.name: Memorial Day Picnic - Middletown Buddhist Meetup
